intro: Antidesma khasianum, commonly known as Khasi antidesma, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the northeastern regions of India. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, followed by red, fleshy berries that are edible for some bird species. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas at moderate elevations.
